details.purpose:
To record the activity related to carrying out a referral from a requesting healthcare provider to a receiving healthcare provider for the patient to receive a specific service, advice or care.
To record the activity related to a self-referral by a patient to a healthcare provider to receive a specific service, advice, or care provision.
details.use:
Use to record the activity related to carrying out a referral from a requesting healthcare provider to a receiving healthcare provider for the patient to receive a specific service, advice or care. For example, referral to a specialist by a GP.
Use to record the activity related to a self-referral by a patient to a healthcare provider to receive a specific service, advice, or care provision. For example, a checkup visit to a dentist for preventive care, or a series of visits to a physiotherapist for management of a musculoskeletal strain.

items.items: Activity regarding a referral from a clinician, or self-referral by a patient, for the patient to receive a specific service, advice or care from an expert healthcare provider.
Referral to healthcare provider is planned.
Appointment for a healthcare provider service has been made.
The healthcare provider has provided the service.
All service activities have been completed and person returned for ongoing care.
The referral has been ceased before the service has been completed.
The planned referral has been postponed.
The planned referral for a service has been cancelled prior to commencement.
The referral has been suspended without completion.
Identification of the clinical service to be/being carried out. This is often coded with an external terminology.
Reason for activity, for example reason referral was stopped early or reason referral was performed.
Type of service to be carried out or being carried out.
The local ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service. This is also referred to as Placer Order Identifier.
Details about the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.
The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for referral. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.
Details about the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for referral.
The total number of services to be undertaken.
The sequence of a particular clinical service.
Duration of service or care provided.
The referral has expired before the referral episode has been completed.
The service was scheduled but not provided.
